meanings.definition: A message recorded by someone when they are not able to take a phone call.
meanings.sent1: I have several voicemails on my phone from friends who called while I was busy.
meanings.sent2: She listened to the voicemails left by her family members while she was at work.
meanings.sent3: The voicemails on his phone were like little surprises waiting to be heard.
meanings.sent4: Her voicemails were like tiny time capsules capturing moments of her loved ones' voices.
meanings.sent5: The voicemails echoed in his mind, each one a reminder of a missed connection.

meanings.definition: The act of leaving a recorded message on a voicemail system.
meanings.sent1: Leaving voicemails is a common way to communicate when you can't reach someone directly.
meanings.sent2: He always hesitates before leaving voicemails, making sure to speak clearly.
meanings.sent3: The voicemails piled up in the system, waiting for their recipients to listen.
meanings.sent4: Her voicemails floated in the digital space, hoping to catch the attention of the receiver.
meanings.sent5: The voicemails danced through the wires, carrying snippets of conversations.
